function_reachability: Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'foo'?
Is it impossible for function 'foo' to reach function 'main'?
Is it impossible for function 'foo' to reach function '__builtin_abort'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i < n - 1' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < n - 1' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'i < N' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < N' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < n - 1' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < N' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'a (line 3)' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'b (line 3)' used after its definition?
liveness: Is variable 'b (line 3)' live at the end of function 'foo'?
Does variable 'i (line 5)' remain in use at the end of function 'foo'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'return 0;' be considered dead code?
Is this statement not dead: “double a[N], b[N], c[N];”?
